constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 36 (Thursday, February 25, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. SMITH of New Jersey:
H.R. 1382.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The constitutional authority on which this bill is based is
Congress's power under the Commerce Clause in Article I,
Section 8 of the Constitution and under the Constitution's
grants of power to Congress under the Equal Protection, Due
Process, and Enforcement Clauses of the Fourteenth Amendment.
[Page H732]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

title: Informed Consent Act
